Sentence.sentence: For years, many of us have relied on antibiotic use to treat various infections.

They include such measures as accountable care organizations to take charge of a patient's needs with an eye on both cost and quality, and chronic disease management to make sure the seriously ill, who are responsible for the bulk of all health care costs, are treated properly.
Studies have shown, for example, that two drugs are about equally effective in treating macular degeneration, an eye disease.
Let us hope these do not include banning gender pronouns,policing children's play, implementing more gender quotas, or treating women's special attachment to home and family as a social injustice.
They are generally treated as equals by men.
Declaring that one country is better than another in the way that it treats more than half its citizens means relying on broad strokes and generalities.
it does not treat all companies equally
Although that can indeed be frustrating, this is probably the only way to treat so grand a topic
We have all seen how a computer's use of personal names often fascinates people and needs them to treat the machine as if it were almost human.
Conformation occurs when others treat you in a manner consistent with who you believe you are
On the other hand, rejection occurs when others treat you in a manner that is inconsistent with yourself definition.
We have all seen how a computer's use of personal names often facinates people and needs them to treat the machine as if it were almost human
They can be treated with the same drug.

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都有"治疗，医治"之意。
means: treat ： 普通用词，指接受并诊治病人。
heal ： 侧重指治愈伤口、伤痛如灼伤等。
remedy ： 着重用药物对病人进行治疗。

Sentence.sentence: By the time she was 13, her company was worth millions of dollars with the invention of a super-sweet treat that could save kids' teeth, instead of destroying them.

Sentence.sentence: However, her dad reminded her that sugary treats were bad for her teeth.

Sentence.sentence: It was a fair trade —I got a pleasure, and she had yet another tasty treat.

Sentence.sentence: It's about time they had to be registered and insured, so when they do hit a pedestrian or a vehicle, or cause an accident, at least they can be treated and there might be an opportunity to claim.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖南卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: Most important, I began to treat them like winners.

Sentence.sentence: Most people treat their tension headaches with pain medicine.

Sentence.sentence: So condors with high levels of lead are sent to Los Angeles zoo, where they are treated with calcium edta, a chemical that removes lead from the blood over several days.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: So, a female cat without children may bring these " treats " to her owner instead.

Sentence.sentence: The disabled should be treated with respect.

Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（6月） 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: They planned to keep the budget low by living on boiled noodles, with the occasional hamburger shop treat.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语江苏卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Treat others with kindness and pity.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 选项

Sentence.sentence: We were treated well by our hosts.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语北京卷 单项填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Today, professors routinely treat the progressive interpretation of history and progressive public policy as the proper subject of study while portraying conservative or classical liberal ideas —such as free markets, self-reliance—as falling outside the boundaries of routine, and sometimes legitimate, intellectual investigation.
California plans to treat 35,000 acres of forest a year by 2020, and 60,000 by 2030- financed from the proceeds of the state's emissions- permit auctions.

Sentence.sentence: similarly, children tend to treat robots as if they are fellow beings, even when they display only simple social signals.

Sentence.sentence: You won't be eating out a lot, but save your pennies and once every few months treat yourself to a set lunch at a good restaurant —￡1.75 a week for three months gives you ￡21 — more than enough for a three course lunch at Michelin-Starred Arbutus.

means.word_mean: 款待, 招待；(东道主提供的)款待；请客；宴请

sentences.en: She was cooking fish as a treat.
sentences.cn: 她正在煮鱼来款待客人。

means.word_mean: 乐事, 乐趣；难得的乐事；快乐的事情

sentences.en: These performances are a great treat to me.
sentences.cn: 看这些表演节目对我来说是一大乐事。

sentences.en: He treated me all right.
sentences.cn: 他待我不错。

sentences.en: Please treat the matter seriously.
sentences.cn: 请认真对待这件事。

sentences.en: The water is chemically treated.
sentences.cn: 这水是经化学处理的。

means.word_mean: 探讨, 讨论, 论述

sentences.en: The book treats the problems of economic development.
sentences.cn: 这本书探讨经济发展的问题。

sentences.en: They treated me as their own child.
sentences.cn: 他们把我当亲生孩子看待。

sentences.en: He treated money as having little value.
sentences.cn: 他认为钱没有多大的价值。

sentences.en: The dentist is treating my teeth.
sentences.cn: 牙科医生给我治牙。

means.word_mean: （利用化学物质或反应）处理，保护，保存

sentences.en: I'll treat today.
sentences.cn: 今天我请客。

sentences.en: He treated them to a good dinner on New Year's Day.
sentences.cn: 在新年那天, 他请他们吃了一顿好饭。

sentences.en: This book treats of the caste system in India.
sentences.cn: 这本书论述了印度的种姓制度。

sentences.en: They will treat with the enemy for peace.
sentences.cn: 他们将与敌人举行和谈。</seg>

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit. informal)used to indicate that someone or something does something specified very well or satisfactorily

entry.def: If you treat someone or something in a particular way, you behave towards them or deal with them in that way.

example.ex: Artie treated most women with indifference...
example.tran: 阿蒂对大多数女人都漠不关心。

example.ex: Police say they're treating it as a case of attempted murder...
example.tran: 警方称他们正把它当作一起谋杀未遂案件来处理。

entry.def: When a doctor or nurse treats a patient or an illness, he or she tries to make the patient well again.

example.tran: 医生用阿司匹林为她治疗。

example.ex: The boy was treated for a minor head wound...
example.tran: 那个男孩因头部轻伤接受了治疗。

entry.def: If something is treated with a particular substance, the substance is put onto or into it in order to clean it, to protect it, or to give it special properties.

example.ex: About 70% of the cocoa acreage is treated with insecticide...
example.tran: 大约 70% 的可可树林地喷过杀虫剂。

example.ex: It was many years before the city began to treat its sewage.
example.tran: 很多年以后这个城市才开始处理污水。

entry.def: If you treat someone to something special which they will enjoy, you buy it or arrange it for them.

example.ex: She was always treating him to ice cream...
Tomorrow I'll treat myself to a day's gardening...
example.tran: 明天我将犒劳一下自己——享受一天的园艺乐趣。

entry.def: If you give someone a treat, you buy or arrange something special for them which they will enjoy.

example.ex: Lettie had never yet failed to return from town without some special treat for him.
example.tran: 莱蒂每次从城里回来都必定会给他带点特别的礼物。

entry.def: If you say that something is your treat, you mean that you are paying for it as a treat for someone else.
If you say, for example, that something looks or works a treat, you mean that it looks very good or works very well.

example.ex: The first part of the plan works a treat...
example.tran: 计划的第一部分天衣无缝。

example.ex: The apricots would go down a treat.

means.word_mean: 2. an occurrence that cause special pleasure or delight

sentences.sentence: "Do right by her"
"Treat him with caution, please"
"Handle the press reporters gently"

means.word_mean: 2. subject to a process or treatment, with the aim of readying for some purpose, improving, or remedying a condition;

sentences.sentence: "process cheese"
"process hair"
"treat the water so it can be drunk"
"treat the lawn with chemicals"
"treat an oil spill"
"The doctor treated my broken leg"
"The nurses cared for the bomb victims"
"The patient must be treated right away or she will die"
"Treat the infection with antibiotics"

means.word_mean: 4. deal with verbally or in some form of artistic expression;

sentences.sentence: "This book deals with incest"
"The course covered all of Western Civilization"
"The new book treats the history of China"

means.word_mean: 5. provide with a gift or entertainment;

sentences.sentence: "Grandmother always treated us to the circus"
"I like to treat myself to a day at a spa when I am depressed"

means.word_mean: 6. provide with choice or abundant food or drink;

sentences.sentence: "Don't worry about the expensive wine--I'm treating"
"She treated her houseguests with good food every night"

means.word_mean: 7. engage in negotiations in order to reach an agreement;

sentences.sentence: "they had to treat with the King"

means.word_mean: 8. regard or consider in a specific way;

sentences.sentence: "I treated his advances as a joke"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the senses 'negotiate' and 'discuss (a subject)'): from Old French traitier, from Latin tractare 'handle', frequentative of trahere 'draw, pull'. The current noun sense dates from the mid 17th cent

sentences.cn: 他们穿成鬼怪的样子, 开晚会,玩恶作剧或款待游戏.
sentences.en: They get dressed up like monsters, have parties and trick or treat.

sentences.en: But once you're there, can you resist milkshake or other treat?

sentences.en: May be I would be enjoying a rack of lean pork ribs as a delicious treat.

sentences.en: Some Hippos at a San Francisco zoo were treated to a Halloween season buffet Wednesday.

sentences.cn: 如果你作为来宾被一位中国人款待, 他会准备很多的食物.

sentences.en: In 1960 Khruschev headed a delegation to visit Indonesia and was royally treated by his host.

sentences.cn: 这一次的款待,是为你而设的. 我们全班都将想念你. 情人节快乐.
sentences.en: This is a treat for you. We will all miss you in class. Happy Valentine's Day.

sentences.en: Every time they come to a new house, they say, " Trick or treat! "

sentences.cn: 她的热情款待使我们感到非常高兴.
sentences.en: Her enthusiastic treat made us very happy.

sentences.cn: 这是全年都能享受到的款待。
sentences.en: It's a treat to be enjoyed all the year round.

sentences.en: They warmly treat the people who come to study here.

sentences.en: Nevan: Of course I will. I'll treat you so nicely , you'll never want to leave.

sentences.en: He treated us to some popcorn, cocoa and tea.

sentences.cn: 真是,请了客人又不好好招待!

sentences.en: They treated us with simple food.

sentences.cn: 我们的老板是个铁公鸡. 他招待我们一顿可真是千载难逢.

sentences.en: Her mother treated him to a nice peanut butter sandwich.

sentences.cn: 招待可能不会太好.

sentences.cn: 我姑姑经常用一些巧克力招待我.
sentences.en: My aunt often gives me a treat of some chocolates.

sentences.cn: 家是我们抱怨得最多, 却被招待得最好的地方.
sentences.en: Home is the place where we grumble the most, but are often treated the best.

sentences.cn: 会谈结束后, 麦克拉伦设晚宴招待了邹家华一行.
sentences.en: After the talks, McLauren treated Jiahua Zou and his delegation to an evening banquet.

sentences.cn: 姑姑带我去逛动物园,作为对我的特殊招待.
sentences.en: My aunt took me to the zoo as a treat.

sentences.cn: 我会无比热情地招待你, 让你流连忘返.

sentences.en: She treated her houseguests with good food every night.

sentences.cn: 我们被招待享用豪华宴席.
sentences.en: We were treated to a royal feast.

sentences.cn: 小孩受到特别招待,给吃牛奶泡泡冰.
sentences.en: The children were given milk shakes as a special treat.

sentences.cn: 通常他们用糖果招待我们.
sentences.en: Usually, they give us some candy as a treat.

sentences.en: While she was undergoing medical treatment, her son's visits are a great treat for her.

sentences.cn: 因此,当她发现自己又成为悉心照料的对象时,感到实在是一件难得的乐事.
sentences.en: Hence it was a treat to her to find herself again the object of thoughtful care.

sentences.cn: 对一个生活在城市中的人,在乡村呆上一天真是一件乐事.
sentences.en: A day in the countryside is a real treat a city person.

sentences.cn: 看这些表演节目对我来说是一大乐事.
sentences.en: These performances are a great treat to me.

sentences.cn: 他们去看戏真是乐事.
sentences.en: It's a great treat for them to go to the theater.

sentences.cn: 进入这乡间和平和宁静的环境是难得的乐事.
sentences.en: What a treat to get into the peace and quiet of the country.

sentences.cn: 可以观赏她的演出真是一件难得的乐事.
sentences.en: It's such a treat to watch her.
